Company: CALIFORNIA PORTLAND CEMEMT CO. d/b/a CATALINA PACIFIC CONCRETE
Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and the U.S. Department of Justice announced that CalPortland Company (CPC), a major producer of Portland cement and building materials in the United States, agreed to pay a $1.425 million dollar penalty to resolve alleged violations of the Clean Air Act at its cement plant in Mojave, California.
Info Source: http://www2.epa.gov/enforcement/california-portland-company-settlement

Description: The US Department of Justice, on behalf of the US Environmental Protection Agency, lodged a consent decree resolving Clean Air Act claims against CalPortland Company with respect to the company's Rillito, Arizona, portland cement plant. The settlement will resolve claims that CalPortland did not obtain permits required by the Clean Air Act. As a result, CalPortland will either upgrade equipment, such as baghouses and spraybars to reduce particle pollution, or install a new, state-of-the-art kiln and retire four existing kilns.  In addition, the cement manufacturer must pay a $350,000 civil penalty.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/b33851a808d7a9f3852577c20056cd7a.html
Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php
